description: I have been trying out Gemini protocol browsers and came across Lagrange and I have to say it might be my favourite so far
pretty darn good app for gemini browsing

To run from a terminal, use this command
flatpak run fi.skyjake.Lagrange

I use rofi to run my programs so I put a bash script in /home/my_username/.local/bin/lagrange
contents of lagrange script:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
flatpak run fi.skyjake.Lagrange

Then make the file executable with
chmod +x /home/my_username/.local/bin/lagrange
summary: A really nice Gemini browsing experience

description: I am enjoying discovering the "old web" here in 2021. There's an entire world of content that is basically hidden from most people as the web is 99% of the internet to most. But if you're willing to dig a little deeper you can find a lot of interesting content in "gopherspace" and now it's possible successor Gemini.
Whether I choose Dark or Light theme, the text is always grey. I want white on black or black on white. Grey text makes it difficult to read.
It's not just great for navigating geminispace, but it has wonderful support of the gopher protocol. It really gives an old protocol a sleek and modern feel.
The screenshot looks nice, but it doesn't event start... I'll keep an eye on it though.
